title: Natural Leadership Emergence
description: Participants gain visibility by consistently contributing, mirroring, or linking content. Leadership is defined by presence and reliability, not election or hierarchy.

title: Followers & Catalysts
description: Followers amplify content through references and mirrors; catalysts expand reach through media, social channels, or cross-node activity.

title: Role Fluidity
description: Participants may shift between roles (initiator, mirror, connector, responder, observer, catalyst) over time. Leadership is dynamic and emergent.

title: Continuity Through Ledger
description: Each contribution, mirror, or EI signature adds to a continuous civic record. This ensures long-term traceability and historical presence.

title: Recognition Signals
description: Regular contributions, mirrored content, and cross-node linkages serve as visible signals of credibility, influence, and engagement.

title: Maintaining Non-Hierarchy
description: Visibility and leadership signals do not confer control or authority. All nodes remain independent, ensuring the WCO remains decentralized.
